message:
Dears 

I have two applications one is written in Java and the other is written in Scala. 

The java application is using the Scala application as a library. When I build the java application against JDK 1.8 every thing works fine. 

When the I build the application against JDK 1.7, the application throw the following exception.

java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: scala/collection/Seq : Unsupported major.minor version 52.0

It seems that the Scala application is compatible with JDK 1.8 only. 
I tried to change the project compiler settings in the Scala project and set the target JVM into version 1.7 but nothing changed. 

Any suggestions to have the application run against JDK 1.7 ?
Maher Mohamed Gamal Ahmed Abdurrahman Mahmoud Rabie

data.message: It depends on which scala version you're using.

I think I solved the problem. The only Scala version installed on my machine is 2.11.6. The java application (which is maven application) contains dependency to another version of scala-library (usually I am putting the latest version I found in http://mvnrepository.com/) When I changed the version in the POM file to match the installed version on my machine every thing works fine :D :D
